intro: Maesa subcaudata var. subintegra, commonly known as the red-flowered maesa, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces small, elliptical berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in well-drained acidic soils and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats.
